title: Princess Charlotte scores special Lionesses gift from legendary Teesside football coach
body_text:
Princess Charlotte scores special Lionesses gift from legendary Teesside football coach
Local legend Eric Powell MBE previously delighted Prince George with a touching token from his past
A Teesside football coach has honoured Princess Charlotte's love of the sport with a special gift.
Eric Powell is well known on Teesside for his contribution to sport and charity, especially when it comes to the beautiful game, and was even awarded an MBE in 2014 for his charity efforts. Following the huge success of England's Lionesses at the UEFA Women's Euro's last year, he decided it was the perfect time for a gift befitting a princess.
The 91-year-old, who is originally from Thornaby, was keen to send something special to Princess Charlotte after previously sending replica medals from his Charity Cup tournament to her older brother and cousin Princes George and Archie. Keeping his own passion for football in mind, he decided on a brilliant present perfect for the seven-year-old.

After writing a letter to the equerry to the the Prince and Princess of Wales before Christmas requesting permission to send a doll for Princess Charlotte, Yarm based Eric finally received news from Kensington Palace saying the gift would be accepted in February. He then got to work on a unique and specially commissioned England women's football Lioness doll.
Inspired by the recent successes of the Lionesses, Eric said: “I watched with joy as the England Ladies Football team lifted the Euro 2022 trophy aloft last summer.
"It was at that moment I realised that an England Ladies doll would be a perfect gift for her Royal Highness Princess Charlotte.”
The doll, inspired by Eric Powell MBE, wears a full England Ladies home team strip which was hand stitched and designed by Kulthida Richardson known locally as Minthra, a local seamstress from Middlesbrough. The doll’s strip bears the number 2 referring to the fact that the Princess was the second born. It also has the Princesses name emblazoned on the back.
Minthra said “I was approached by Eric Powell MBE who asked If I could make a replica kit for a doll which would be sent to her Royal Highness Princess Charlotte. At first, I thought it was a wind up but when he showed me the letter from Kensington Palace I knew it was the real thing.”
There has been a huge rise in the popularity of women's football since the Lionesses Euro's success. Prince William and Princess Charlotte even recorded a special message to the team prior to the finals, with the young Princess sending her best wishes to the inspiring sports stars.
